channel.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
channel.description: For about a week now I've been unable to get anywhere on the forums/site, just been handed a 400 - Bad Request error. I can access the moparisthebest.com forums, but the layouts fucked. Works fine in chrome/IE just not firefox.

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

No other way around Firefox fails to load, its only on my mac and using firefox, all other browsers and os works… strange.

maybe im holding it wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Ollie:

its firefox, how would i set it manually?

I thought you said firefox worked and safari was the one that didn’t. Everyone I know uses firefox and it certainly works on this site, are you sure it isn’t set to not accept cookies? You could install the Live Header extension and see if my server sends you the Set-Cookie header.

I think you have to have an extension to create cookies, I’ve done it before.

Read full topic

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

off-topic: b3 SUCKS! The menus have all been changed around, and it’s a pain to navigate now.

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

its firefox, how would i set it manually?

Read full topic

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Ollie:

it doesnt work, im open to trying anything…

I’ve restarted the server, I guess you can try again now, I’ve never had anyone have a problem with that script setting a cookie. With that browser can you set a cookie manually?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

it doesnt work, im open to trying anything…

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

For me it wasn’t a cookie issue - I had to use a different internet connection or just wait a week to access the site. Are you sure it’s nothing to do with caching?

Read full topic

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Seems like it isn’t setting the cookie at all :s

Read full topic

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:19, topic:353093”]using firefox on my mac i cannot access the forums, it continually loops on the TOS page, works on safari though.

I have cleared cookies, cache, re-installed firefox, used 4.0b2, swapped back to 3.6 still no luck any ideas?[/quote]

All the TOS page does is set a cookie. Check to see if that cookie is set or not.

Read full topic

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:17, topic:353093”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=449406.msg3297260#msg3297260 date=1281033524]
I grep the logs for 400 errors and very rarely a certain IP (user) will get one. I know Tico did a few weeks ago and clearing his cookies fixed it.

Still, what OS are you using with this firefox?
[/quote]I got them for about a week straight until I cleared my cookies again today and it finally worked[/quote]This happened to me a while ago, clearing cookies did it.

Read full topic

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

using firefox on my mac i cannot access the forums, it continually loops on the TOS page, works on safari though.

I have cleared cookies, cache, re-installed firefox, used 4.0b2, swapped back to 3.6 still no luck any ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:17, topic:353093”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=449406.msg3297260#msg3297260 date=1281033524]
I grep the logs for 400 errors and very rarely a certain IP (user) will get one. I know Tico did a few weeks ago and clearing his cookies fixed it.

Still, what OS are you using with this firefox?
[/quote]I got them for about a week straight until I cleared my cookies again today and it finally worked[/quote]

Very odd, maybe I need to add a ‘clear your cookies’ message to the 400 page until this is sorted out.

Read full topic

Still, what OS are you using with this firefox?[/quote]I got them for about a week straight until I cleared my cookies again today and it finally worked

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

It hadn’t ever happened to me before, up until I used the https:// functionality you added to the site. And that’s when I first got the 400 error, But I had also just upgraded to 4.0b around that time also, so these things are probably completely unrelated.

Read full topic

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Unhandled:

I heard apache is pretty good.

Good in some ways, but slow as hell, far worse configuration syntax, and easily taken down by script kiddies also. As of a few weeks ago, I’ve been using lighttpd for a long time with no problems at all, it must just be a bad version.

Read full topic

item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

happened twice to me, one with firefox 4 1 beta and i eventually cleared cookies to fix it then i think i had it again on firefox4 beta 2 and i think that sorted itself out. Don’t remember exactly though

Read full topic

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

This always happens to me, and it’s fucking annoying to fix. I usually get a load of random cookie errors first so have to clear cookies+cache, but then I get the 400 errors after and even using a different browser has no effect. If I leave it for a few days, it works fine. Maybe it’s something to do with squid?

ps, it’s happened on xp and ubuntu, on firefox, chrome, opera and ie.

Once I’m logged in and everythings working, I don’t get the error at all.

Read full topic

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

I’m on windows 7.

Read full topic

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

This happened to me on both Firefox 3.6 and the 4.0 beta

Clearing cookies/cache would let me see the site again then when I would try to login it would appear again. So I would just wait a bit and it would be back to normal.

Read full topic

item.title: 400 - Bad Request on Firefox 4.0b2
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I grep the logs for 400 errors and very rarely a certain IP (user) will get one. I know Tico did a few weeks ago and clearing his cookies fixed it.

Still, what OS are you using with this firefox?

Read full topic
